com.ciscospark.androidsdk.phone

Interface Call


  • public interface Call
    A Call represents a media call on Cisco Spark.

    The application can create an outgoing call by calling Phone.dial function:

    The application can receive an incoming call on Phone.IncomingCallListener:

    Since:
    0.1
    See Also:
    Phone

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Call.CallStatus
      The status of a Call.
      static class  Call.Direction
      The enumeration of directions of a call

      • getVideoRenderViews

        Returns:
        The render views for local and remote video of this call.
        Since:
        1.3.0

      • setVideoRenderViews

        void setVideoRenderViews(@Nullable
                         android.util.Pair<android.view.View,android.view.View> videoRenderViews)
        Parameters:
        videoRenderViews - render views for local and remote video of this call. If is nil, it will update the video state as inactive to the server side.
        Since:
        1.3.0

      • getSharingRenderView

        android.view.View getSharingRenderView()
        Returns:
        The render view for the remote content sharing of this call.
        Since:
        1.3.0

      • setSharingRenderView

        void setSharingRenderView(android.view.View view)
        Parameters:
        view - The render view for the remote content sharing of this call. If is nil, it will update the content sharing state as inactive to the server side.
        Since:
        1.3.0

      • acknowledge

        void acknowledge(@NonNull
                 CompletionHandler<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Acknowledge (without answering) an incoming call. Will cause the initiator's Call instance to emit the ringing event.
        Parameters:
        callback - A closure to be executed when completed, with error if the invocation is illegal or failed, otherwise nil.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Call.CallStatus

      • answer

        void answer(@NonNull
            MediaOption option,
            @NonNull
            CompletionHandler<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Answers this call. This can only be invoked when this call is incoming and in ringing status.
        Parameters:
        option - Intended media options - audio only or audio and video - for the call.
        callback - A closure to be executed when completed, with error if the invocation is illegal or failed, otherwise nil.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Call.CallStatus

      • reject

        void reject(@NonNull
            CompletionHandler<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Rejects this call. This can only be invoked when this call is incoming and in ringing status.
        Parameters:
        callback - A closure to be executed when completed, with error if the invocation is illegal or failed, otherwise nil.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Call.CallStatus

      • hangup

        void hangup(@NonNull
            CompletionHandler<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Disconnects this call. This can only be invoked when this call is in answered status.
        Parameters:
        callback - A closure to be executed when completed, with error if the invocation is illegal or failed, otherwise nil.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Call.CallStatus

      • isSendingDTMFEnabled

        boolean isSendingDTMFEnabled()
        Returns:
        True if the DTMF keypad is enabled for this *call*. Otherwise, false.
        Since:
        0.1

      • sendDTMF

        void sendDTMF(java.lang.String dtmf,
              @NonNull
              CompletionHandler<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Sends DTMF events to the remote party. Valid DTMF events are 0-9, *, #, a-d, and A-D.
        Parameters:
        dtmf - any combination of valid DTMF events matching regex mattern "^[0-9#\*abcdABCD]+$"
        callback - A closure to be executed when completed, with error if the invocation is illegal or failed, otherwise nil.
        Since:
        0.1

      • sendFeedback

        void sendFeedback(int rating,
                  @Nullable
                  java.lang.String comment)
        Sends feedback for this call to Cisco Spark team.
        Parameters:
        rating - The rating of the quality of this call between 1 and 5 where 5 means excellent quality.
        comment - The comments for this call.
        Since:
        0.1
